Kemudian pertanyaan di atas langsung dijawab, bahwa berita besar dan lebih buruk dari kemarahannya itu ialah azab neraka yang telah dijanjikan kepada orang-orang kafir sebagai balasan dari perbuatan mereka itu waktu hidup di dunia. Neraka itu adalah seburuk-buruk tempat kembali yang disediakan bagi orang-orang musyrik.
text.73:
Ayat ini menyeru manusia terutama orang-orang yang mem-persekutukan Allah dengan menyembah patung yang terbuat dari benda mati dan dibuat oleh mereka sendiri, agar mereka memperhatikan perumpamaan yang dibuat Allah bagi mereka, kemudian merenungkan dan memikirkannya dengan sebaik-baiknya. Apakah yang telah mereka lakukan itu sesuai dengan akal pikiran yang benar, hendaklah direnungkan kembali ayat-ayat Allah yang dibacakan itu, agar mereka mendapat petunjuk.

Perumpamaan itu ialah segala berhala yang mereka sembah itu, dengan tujuan untuk mendekatkan diri kepada Allah, dan mereka memohonkan sesuatu kepadanya, meski patung-patung itu tidak dapat menciptakan sesuatu. Begitu pula sekiranya patung itu mempunyai suatu barang, kemudian barang itu disambar oleh seekor lalat kecil, lemah dan tidak ada kekuatannya, niscaya patung-patung yang mereka sembah itu tidak akan sanggup merebut barang itu kembali dari lalat yang kecil itu.

Perumpamaan yang dikemukakan Allah dalam ayat ini, seakan-akan memperingatkan orang-orang yang menyembah patung atau benda mati itu, bahwa Tuhan yang berhak disembah ialah Tuhan Yang Maha Perkasa, Maha Pencipta, tidak ada sesuatu kekuatan pun yang dapat mengatasi kekuatan-Nya. Jika orang-orang kafir menyembah patung, berarti mereka menyembah benda mati, yang tidak tahu suatu apapun, bahkan ia tidak dapat mempertahankan apa yang dimilikinya, seandainya seekor lalat kecil yang tidak berdaya merampas kepunyaannya itu daripadanya. Apakah patung yang demikian itu layak disembah? Tindakan orang-orang musyrik itu menunjukkan kebodohan-nya. Alangkah kelirunya orang-orang yang menyembah patung itu, demikian pula patung yang disembah itu.
text.74:
Orang-orang musyrik mengaku bahwa mereka menyembah berhala atau patung itu adalah untuk mendekatkan diri kepada Allah. Tetapi pengakuan mereka itu dibantah Allah bahwa cara yang mereka lakukan itu, tidak saja menghina Allah, bahkan menganggap bahwa Allah tidak dapat langsung menerima permohonan dan mengabulkan doa hamba-hamba-Nya, sehingga perlu adanya sesuatu yang membantunya sebagai perantara.

Sungguh Allah yang berhak disembah itu Mahakuat dan Kuasa, Maha Perkasa, tidak ada sesuatu pun yang dapat mengalahkan-Nya. Dia berbuat menurut yang dikehendaki-Nya, tidak seperti patung yang disembah oleh orang-orang musyrik itu, yang tidak dapat merebut kembali, benda yang telah direbut lalat daripadanya. Allah berfirman:

Sungguh Allah, Dialah Pemberi rezeki Yang Mempunyai Kekuatan lagi Sangat Kokoh. (adz-dzariyat/51: 58)
text.75:
Diriwayatkan bahwa Walid bin Mugirah pernah berkata, "Apakah pernah diturunkan wahyu atasnya di antara kita?" Maka Allah menurunkan ayat ini.

Pada ayat ini Allah menerangkan bahwa Dia telah memilih beberapa orang di antara para malaikat, untuk menjadi perantara antara Dia dengan para Rasul yang diutusnya, untuk menyampaikan wahyu, seperti malaikat jibril. Demikian pula Allah telah memilih beberapa orang rasul yang akan menyampaikan agama-Nya kepada manusia. Hak memilih para rasul adalah hak Allah, tidak seorang pun yang berwenang menetapkannya selain dari Dia. Allah Maha Mendengar semua yang diucapkan oleh hamba-hamba-Nya, melihat keadaan dan mengetahui kadar kemampuan mereka, sehingga Dia dapat menetapkan dan memilih siapa yang patut menjadi rasul atau nabi di antara mereka.

Hadis Nabi saw, beliau bersabda:

Sesungguhnya Allah telah memilih Musa sebagai Kalimullah dan Ibrahim sebagai Khalilullah. (Riwayat al-Hakim dalam al-Mustadrak dari Ibnu 'Abbas).
text.76: Allah Maha Mengetahui keadaan para malaikat dan keadaan manusia, baik sebelum mereka diciptakan maupun sesudah mereka diciptakan dan mengetahui pula keadaan mereka sesudah tiada nanti. Allah Maha Mengetahui apa yang akan terjadi, apa yang telah terjadi, dan mengetahui pula akhir segala sesuatu nanti, karena kepada-Nyalah kembalinya urusan segala sesuatu.
text.77:
Pada ayat ini Allah memerintahkan kepada orang-orang yang beriman agar:

1. Mengerjakan salat pada waktu-waktu yang telah ditentukan, lengkap dengan syarat-syarat dan rukun-rukunnya. Pada ayat ini salat disebut dengan "ruku'" dan "sujud", karena ruku' dan sujud itu merupakan ciri khas dari salat dan termasuk dalam rukun-rukunnya.

2. Menghambakan diri, bertobat kepada Allah, dan beribadah kepada-Nya merupakan perwujudan dari keimanan di hati sanubari yang telah merasakan kebesaran, kekuasaan dan keagungan Allah, karena diri manusia sangat tergantung kepada-Nya. Hanya Dialah yang menciptakan, memelihara kelangsungan hidup dan mengatur seluruh makhluk-Nya. Beribadah kepada Tuhan ada yang dilakukan secara langsung, seperti salat, puasa bulan Ramadan, menunaikan zakat dan menunaikan ibadah haji. Ada pula ibadah yang dilakukan tidak secara langsung, seperti berbuat baik kepada sesama manusia, tolong menolong, mengolah alam yang diciptakan Allah untuk kepentingan manusia.

3. Mengerjakan perbuatan-perbuatan yang baik, seperti memperkuat hubungan silaturrahmi, berbudi pekerti yang baik, hormat menghormati, kasih-mengasihi sesama manusia. Termasuk melaksanakan perintah Allah.

Jika manusia mengerjakan tiga macam perintah di atas, maka mereka akan berhasil dalam kehidupan memperoleh kebahagiaan ketentraman hidup, dan di akhirat mereka akan memperoleh surga yang penuh kenikmatan.
text.78:
Di samping perintah-perintah di atas, Allah juga memerintahkan kepada orang-orang yang beriman agar berjihad di jalan Allah dengan sungguh-sungguh, semata-mata dilaksanakan karena Allah dan janganlah kaum Muslimin merasa khawatir dan takut kepada siapa pun dalam berjihad selain kepada Allah.

Ada empat macam jihad di jalan Allah yaitu:

1. Jihad dalam arti mempertahankan diri dari serangan musuh, sebagaimana firman Allah:

Dan perangilah di jalan Allah orang-orang yang memerangi kamu, tetapi jangan melampaui batas. (al-Baqarah/2: 190)

2. Jihad dalam arti menegakkan agama Allah dan untuk meninggikannya, sebagaimana firman Allah:

Dan perangilah mereka itu sampai tidak ada lagi fitnah, dan agama hanya bagi Allah semata. Jika mereka berhenti (dari kekafiran), maka sesungguhnya Allah Maha Melihat apa yang mereka kerjakan. (al- Anfal/8: 39)

3. Jihad dengan arti berusaha melepaskan diri dari godaan setan, yang mengarah kepada masalah kemanusiaan seperti menolong orang, bertugas untuk kebaikan dan lain sebagainya, sebagaimana firman Allah:

Orang-orang yang beriman, mereka berperang di jalan Allah, dan orang-orang yang kafir berperang di jalan Tagut, maka perangilah kawan-kawan setan itu, (karena) sesungguhnya tipu daya setan itu lemah. (an-Nisa'/4:76)

4. Jihad dengan arti memerangi hawa nafsu, sebagaimana diterangkan dalam hadis Nabi: Dari Jabir ia berkata, "Telah datang kepada Rasulullah saw suatu kaum yang baru dari peperangan. Maka beliau bersabda, "Kamu datang dengan kedatangan yang baik, kamu telah datang dari jihad yang kecil dan akan memasuki jihad yang besar." Seseorang berkata, "Apakah jihad yang besar itu?" Rasulullah menjawab, "Perjuangan hamba melawan hawa nafsu." (Riwayat al-Khatib al-Baghdadi)

Pada mulanya peperangan itu dibenci oleh kaum Muslimin, sebagaimana firman Allah:

Diwajibkan atas kamu berperang, padahal itu tidak menyenangkan bagimu. (al-Baqarah/2: 216)

Sekalipun perang itu dibenci oleh kaum Muslimin, tetapi karena tujuannya untuk mempertahankan diri dan menegakkan agama Allah, maka peperangan itu dibolehkan dan kaum Muslimin harus melakukannya. Dalam pada itu Allah melarang kaum Muslimin melakukan perbuatan-perbuatan yang melampaui batas dalam peperangan.

Dalam ayat ini diterangkan bahwa Allah telah memilih umat Muhammad untuk melakukan jihad. Perintah itu datang karena agama yang dibawa Muhammad adalah agama yang telah disempurnakan Allah, yang di dalamnya terdapat ketentuan-ketentuan tentang Jihad. Hal ini merupakan pertolongan Allah kepada Nabi Muhammad beserta umatnya.

Allah menerangkan bahwa agama yang telah diturunkan-Nya kepada Muhammad itu bukanlah agama yang sempit dan sulit, tetapi adalah agama yang lapang dan tidak menimbulkan kesulitan kepada hamba yang melakukannya. Semua perintah dan larangan yang terdapat dalam agama Islam bertujuan untuk melapangkan dan memudahkan hidup manusia, agar mereka hidup berbahagia di dunia dan di akhirat. Hanya saja hawa nafsu manusialah yang mempengaruhi dan menimbulkan dalam pikiran mereka bahwa perintah-perintah dan larangan-larangan Allah itu terasa berat dikerjakan.

Rasulullah saw mengatakan bahwa agama Islam itu mudah, orang-orang yang memberat-beratkan beban dalam agama akan dikalahkan oleh agama sendiri, sebagaimana tersebut dalam hadis:

Dari Abi Hurairah ra, dari Nabi saw, beliau bersabda, "Sesungguhnya agama itu mudah dan sekali-kali tidak akan ada seorang pun yang memberatkan agama, kecuali agama itu akan mengalahkannya. Karena itu kerjakanlah dengan benar, dekatkanlah dirimu, gembiralah, dan mohonlah pertolongan di pagi dan petang hari serta waktu berpergian awal malam." (Riwayat al-Bukhari)

Rasulullah saw pernah memberikan suatu peringatan yang keras kepada suatu golongan yang memberatkan beban dalam agama, sebagaimana tersebut dalam hadis.

Dari 'Aisyah ra, ia berkata, "Rasulullah saw pernah membuat sesuatu, lalu beliau meringankannya, lalu sampailah hal yang demikian kepada beberapa orang sahabat beliau. Seolah-olah mereka tidak menyukainya dan meninggalkannya. Maka sampailah persoalan itu pada beliau. Beliau lalu berdiri berpidato dan berkata: Apakah gerangan keadaan orang-orang yang telah sampai kepada mereka tentang sesuatu perbuatan yang aku meringankannya, lalu mereka tidak menyukainya dan meninggalkannya? Demi Allah (kata Rasululah): Sesungguhnya aku adalah orang yang paling tahu di antara mereka tentang Allah dan orang yang paling takut di antara mereka kepada-Nya." (Riwayat al-Bukhari dan Muslim)

Diriwayatkan bahwa beberapa orang sahabat Rasul ingin menandingi beliau, sehingga ada yang berkata, "Aku akan puasa setiap hari." Yang lain lagi berkata, "Aku tidak akan mengawini perempuan." Maka sampailah hal itu kepada Rasulullah, lalu beliau bersabda:

Apakah gerangan keadaan orang yang telah mengharamkan perempuan, makan dan tidur? Ketahuilah, sesungguhnya aku salat dan tidur, berpuasa dan berbuka puasa serta menikahi perempuan-perempuan. Barangsiapa yang benci kepada sunnahku, maka ia bukanlah termasuk umatku. (Riwayat an-Nasa'i)

Dengan keterangan hadis-hadis di atas nyatalah bahwa agama Islam adalah agama yang lapang, meringankan beban, tidak picik dan tidak mempersulit. Seandainya ada praktek dan amalan agama Islam yang memberatkan, picik dan sempit, maka hal itu bukanlah berasal dari agama Islam, tetapi berasal dari orang yang tidak mengetahui hakikat Islam itu.

Dalam kehidupan sehari-hari terlihat masih banyak kaum Muslimin yang belum memahami dengan baik tujuan Allah menurunkan syariat-Nya kepada Nabi saw. Seperti Allah mensyariatkan salat dengan tujuan agar manusia terhindar dari perbuatan keji dan mungkar, tetapi sebagian kaum Muslimin merasa berat mengerjakan salat yang lima waktu itu, bahkan ada di antara mereka yang mengatakan bahwa salat itu menganggu waktu berharga bagi mereka. Demikian pula pendapat mereka tentang ibadah-ibadah lainnya.

Kemudian Allah menerangkan bahwa agama yang dibawa Muhammad itu adalah sesuai dengan agam Ibrahim, nenek moyang bangsa Arab dan kedua agama itu sama-sama bersendikan ketauhidan. Seakan-akan Allah memperingatkan kepada bangsa Arab waktu itu, "Hai bangsa Arab, kamu mengaku memeluk agama yang dibawa nenek moyangmu Ibrahim, karena itu ikutilah agama yang dibawa Muhammad, agama yang berazaskan tauhid, tidak ada kesempitan dan kepicikan di dalamnya. Dan Allah menamakan orang-orang yang memeluk agama tauhid dengan "muslim"."

Dalam ayat ini disebutkan bahwa Rasulullah saw menjadi saksi di hari Kiamat atas umatnya. Maksudnya ialah dia bersaksi bahwa ia telah menyampaikan risalah Allah kepada mereka, menyeru mereka agar beriman kepada Allah dan agar mereka tetap berpegang teguh kepada agama Allah, serta beribadah kepada Allah dan melaksanakan perintah-perintah-Nya dan menjauhkan larangan-larangan-Nya. Sedangkan kaum Muslimin menjadi saksi atas manusia di hari Kiamat kelak, maksudnya ialah mereka telah melakukan seperti yang telah dilakukan Rasul atas mereka, yaitu mereka telah menyeru manusia agar beriman, menyampaikan agama Allah, melakukan tugas yang dibebankan Allah dan Rasul kepada mereka dengan sebaik-baiknya. Setelah itu mereka menyerahkan urusan mereka kepada Allah, apakah ajakan mereka diterima atau ditolak.

Sebagian Ahli tafsir dalam menafsirkan ayat ini menyatakan bahwa kaum Muslimin menjadi saksi atas manusia termasuk di dalam persaksian mereka atas umat-umat terdahulu, yang telah diutus kepada mereka Rasul-rasul. Mereka mengetahui hal itu dari Allah melalui Al-Qur'an yang menerangkan bahwa Rasul dahulu telah menyampaikan agama yang bedasar tauhid kepada mereka.

Semua perintah Allah yang disebutkan itu dapat dilaksanakan dengan baik, agar umat Muhammad yang ditugaskan menjadi saksi terhadap manusia pada hari Kiamat dapat melakukan persaksian itu dengan sebaik-baiknya, maka Allah memerintahkan kepada mereka:

1. Selalu melaksanakan salat yang lima waktu, karena salat menjauhkan manusia dari perbuatan keji dan mungkar dan merupakan penghubung yang kuat antara Tuhan yang disembah dengan hamba-Nya.

2. Menunaikan zakat, agar dapat membersihkan jiwa dan harta, agar mempersempit jurang antara si kaya dan si miskin.

3. Berpegang teguh dengan tali Allah dengan melaksanakan perintah-perintah-Nya dan menjauhkan segala larangan-Nya.

en.name: The Pilgrimage
en.source: Aplikasi Quran Kementrian Agama Republik Indonesia

text.1:
This verse urges humans to be self-aware and protect themselves from Allah's punishment by following His commands and avoiding His prohibitions. This command applies from the time this verse was revealed until the Day of Judgment, which will be marked by a tremendous earthquake, destroying everything in this universe. Allah commands this because the tremors and disasters that occur on that terrible day are unparalleled. In another verse, Allah explains the tremors and earthquakes that will occur on that day. Allah says:

"When the earth is shaken with its [final] earthquake, And the earth discharges its burdens." (az-Zalzalah/99: 1-2)

And Allah says:

"And the earth and the mountains are lifted and leveled at each other with one blow - That is the Day the Occurrence will occur." (al-Haqqah/69: 14-15)

From that verse, it is understood that those who are pious will not feel horrified and afraid on the Day of Judgment, because they have believed that the Day of Judgment will surely occur, that they are truly certain to receive Allah's protection and help on that day, and are also certain that no one can provide protection and help on that day except Allah, the Almighty, the Most Merciful to His servants. Conversely, those who disbelieve in Allah; do not follow His commands and do not stop His prohibitions will feel the consequences of the earth's tremors and the destruction of the world at that time, as an unparalleled punishment. They cannot avoid it in the slightest and no one can help them, because Allah will only help and protect His servants.

According to a narration, this verse was revealed at night, during the battle of Bani Mustalik, then the Prophet Muhammad saw recited this verse to his companions. After he recited this verse, he wept and some of the companions also wept, some were anxious and some pondered this verse. This shows how worried the Prophet Muhammad saw and his companions were about the great disaster that would occur on the Day of Judgment, even though faith and patience had been firmly imprinted within them, and they also believed that Allah would surely help the Muslims.

The Day of Judgment is the day of the destruction of the world, a transition from the life of this mortal world to the life of the hereafter which is eternal and everlasting. At that time, a terrible event will occur, all the planets and celestial bodies will collide with each other, so that they will break apart into fine fragments. At that time, everything in this universe will disappear. The only thing that will not disappear at that time is the Almighty, the All-Powerful Lord. After this mortal world has completely disappeared, Allah will replace it with another world, namely the hereafter. At that time, all humans will be resurrected from their graves to have their deeds weighed. Good deeds will be rewarded with paradise full of pleasures, while evil and bad deeds will be rewarded with painful torment in a blazing hell. At that time, humans will obtain true justice from their Lord, which they did not obtain during their life in the world.

Belief in the Day of Judgment is one of the pillars of faith that must be believed and believed by everyone who claims to have faith in Allah and in the Prophet Muhammad saw who He has sent. The Day of Judgment is one of the unseen matters, therefore it is difficult to present concrete evidence about the Day of Judgment. However, if a person truly believes that Allah is All-Powerful and All-Just, He loves and has mercy on His believing servants, then that person will come to believe in the existence of the Day of Judgment.
text.2:
In this verse, it is explained how terrible the events that occur on the Day of Judgment are and how great their impact is on a person, including:

1. On that day, a mother who is breastfeeding her child will neglect her child. Even though the relationship between a mother and her child is the closest relationship compared to human relationships with other humans. Likewise, the relationship of affection between a mother and her child is a relationship of affection that will never be broken. Among the manifestations of the affectionate relationship between a mother and her child is that the mother breastfeeds her young child selflessly, and breast milk is the staple food for the baby. Without that food, the baby could starve to death, and every mother is fully aware of the consequences. Therefore, the mother is obliged to breastfeed her child, who is the apple of her eye, whenever necessary. On the Day of Judgment, which is so terrible and dreadful, it is as if that relationship is severed. In the mother's self at that time arises a feeling of fear and horror seeing the chaotic atmosphere, so that the mother forgets to breastfeed her child, and forgets everything, including her breastfeeding child.

2. On the Day of Judgment, all the wombs of pregnant women will miscarry. Usually, miscarriages in pregnant women occur if there is a very shocking and frightening event or because of falling or experiencing severe shocks, such as vehicle shocks and so on. On the Day of Judgment, there will be an earthquake and a great shock that will destroy living humans, including pregnant women along with the children they are carrying.

Al-Hasan said, what is meant by "every nursing mother will be distracted from that which she was nursing" is negligence that is not caused by weaning the child, and what is meant by "every pregnant woman will abort her load" is that the child being carried is born before its time.

3. On that day, people will look like they are drunk, even though they are not drunk. This shows their confusion, not knowing what they should do, all in a state of fear, looking for a place to take refuge, and trying to avoid the disaster that is befalling them.

The circumstances and events described above are to illustrate and depict to humans how terrible the disaster that will occur on the Day of Judgment is, so that the depiction can be a lesson and a warning for them, even though the actual event is even more terrible than what is depicted. While the actual event that occurs on the Day of Judgment cannot be described in its awfulness, because there is no previous event that can be used as a comparison.
text.3:
This verse explains that even though Allah has explained the events that will occur on the Day of Judgment, many people deny them, and even act beyond that. They not only say that Allah is not able to resurrect and revive humans after they are destroyed and scattered into the earth, that Allah has children and partners, that the contents of the Qur'an are nothing but tales of ancient people, but they do more than that, which is to challenge Allah. They say, "If Allah is truly All-Powerful, then try to send down the painful punishment that was promised," and other challenges.

According to Ibn Abi Hatim, this verse was revealed in connection with Nadhar bin Harish, who refuted the oneness and power of Allah by saying, "The angels are the daughters of Allah, the Qur'an is nothing but the tales of ancient people. Allah is not able to revive those who have died whose bodies have been destroyed and turned into dust."

According to Zamakhsyari, "Even though this verse was addressed to Nadhar bin Haris at the time of its revelation, this verse is general and addressed to all those who refute Allah, without knowledge and establish attributes that are not worthy of Him."

Allah rebukes those who argue about Allah, denying His oneness and power, without a basis of true knowledge and strong evidence. If they want to present something about Allah, they should use strong arguments and evidence. At the same time, Allah warns that human reason and thought will not be able to recognize and think about the essence of Allah, because the essence of Allah is something unseen. But if you want to know the existence of God, His oneness and power, think about the creatures that He has created, such as the universe and all its contents, the laws that govern it, the earth with all its contents, the mountains with their valleys, the vast ocean with all its contents, and themselves and all the creatures that Allah has created.

Allah says:

And have they not reflected within themselves? Allah has not created the heavens and the earth and what is between them except in truth and for a specified term. And indeed, many among the people, are deniers of the meeting with their Lord. (ar-Rum/30: 8)

And Allah says:

And He has cast into the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shake with you, and rivers and roads, that you may be guided. And landmarks. And by the stars they are guided. Then is He who creates like one who does not create? So will you not be reminded? (an-Nahl/16: 15-17)

Allah rebukes those who have bad character, namely those who follow Satan. Satan has a bad character because he follows and indulges his desires, because of his arrogance he refused to prostrate to Adam as Allah commanded. He commits acts that Allah has forbidden, wanting others to follow his reprehensible deeds, striving with all his cunning to make people see as good all the acts that Allah has forbidden, such as associating partners with God, drinking khamar, gambling, committing adultery, hoarding wealth for personal gain, oppressing others, and so on. Some of these devils are jinn devils and some are human devils.
text.4:
This verse explains that Allah has given Satan the opportunity to make every effort to mislead and deceive mankind, so that mankind becomes misguided and disbelieving as he did. But this effort can only be done against those who disbelieve and do not believe in Allah and His Messenger. While Allah's servants who are believers and sincere cannot be disturbed or deceived by them in the slightest.

Allah says:

He (Iblis) said, "My Lord, because You have put me in error, I will surely make (disobedience) attractive to them on earth, and I will mislead them all, except Your chosen servants among them." (al-Hijr/15: 39-40)

From this verse, it can be understood that Allah reminds mankind to be wary of Satan's temptations. Whoever follows Satan's temptations and takes his path, then Allah also misleads them by widening the path that Satan has laid out so that they can easily pass through it. Therefore, they will be put into hell together with the Satan who tempted them. A person who has become accustomed to following Satan's path finds it very difficult to return to the right path, because his heart has been covered by Satan's desires.

Allah says:

Whomever Allah leaves astray - there is for him no guide. And He leaves them wandering blindly in their transgression. (al-A'raf/7: 186)
text.5:
In this verse, Allah challenges those who disbelieve in the Day of Judgment and the Day of Resurrection. If they still disbelieve, let them present reasons and evidence that can strengthen their opinion. But they cannot present it. Therefore, Allah gives an example of themselves, starting from sperm-ovum, then becoming a zygote, 'alaqah, fetus, then being born and growing up, and then dying. If creating from nothing Allah is capable, of course, repeating the creation of humans is easier than the first creation.

Those who do not believe in the Day of Resurrection consider resurrection to be an impossible event. In their view, it is impossible for bones that have decayed and scattered, and flesh that has been destroyed and turned into soil, to reunite in their original form. They measure Allah's ability and power the same as their own ability and power. If they feel unable to do something, then Allah will certainly not be able to do it either. Those who disbelieve do so solely because of denial, because they are controlled by lust and the temptations of Satan, while their hearts and minds actually acknowledge it. They are worried that their position and rank will be threatened if they follow the beliefs and religion brought by Muhammad saw. Therefore, they argue with Allah without a basis in true knowledge.

In this verse, Allah presents guidance about the existence of the Day of Resurrection by presenting two kinds of reasons. The first is related to the process of human creation, and the second is related to the process of life and growth of plants.

The process of human creation in the mother's womb and its life from birth to death is as follows:

1. Allah created the first human, namely Adam as, from soil. Then from Adam, his wife Hawa was created, and from these two creatures, humans multiplied through a fairly long process. It can also mean that humans are created by Allah through the fertilization of an ovum by sperm in a woman's womb. Both cells come from blood, blood comes from food that humans eat, and human food comes from plants and some come from livestock or other animals. All of that comes from the soil even though it has gone through several processes. Therefore, it is not wrong to say that humans come from the soil.

2. In this verse, it is mentioned that humans come from *nuthfah*. What is meant by *nuthfah* is a zygote, which is an ovum that has been fertilized by sperm.

3. *'Alaqah*, which is a zygote that has attached to the woman's womb.

4. *Mudhgah*, which is an *'alaqah* that has formed a collection of meat cells, the size of something chewed. (*mudhgah* means chewing). Some *mudhgah* grow perfectly, without defects, and some grow imperfectly and with defects. This perfect and imperfect event causes human physical perfection, defects, or miscarriages. The process of *nuthfah* becoming *'alaqah* is forty days, from *'alaqah* to *mudhgah* is also forty days. Then after forty days have passed, Allah breathes the spirit, determines sustenance, deeds, happiness and misery, determines the end of life, and so on, as mentioned in the hadith: "Indeed, the creation of one of you is gathered in his mother's womb for 40 nights in the form of *nuthfah*, then it becomes *'alaqah* for the same period, then it becomes *mudhgah* for the same period. Then Allah sends an angel, then breathes the spirit into it, then (the angel) is ordered to write four sentences, namely writing his sustenance, his deeds, his end of life, happiness or misery." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from Ibn Mas'ud)

In another hadith it is explained:

Rasulullah saw said, "The angel comes to the *nuthfah* after it has settled in the womb for 40 or 45 days, then he says, "O my Lord: Is it bad or good?" (Then Allah says whether it is bad or good), then both are written (i.e. bad or good). Then the angel says again, "O my Lord, is it male or female?" (Then Allah says whether it is male or female), then both are written (i.e. male or female), and work, inheritance, end of life and sustenance are written. Then the sheets are closed, then what has been written in them cannot be added to or subtracted from." (Narrated by Ibn Abi Hatim and Muslim)

Allah determines such a creation process, namely letting *nuthfah*, *'alaqah*, *mudhgah* until it forms a perfect fetus in the time determined, is to explain to humans the signs of His power, greatness and the strength of the rules He has made, and to be material for human thought, that if Allah is able to create humans for the first time, then He is certainly able to create them for the second time, and creating something for the second time is usually easier than creating it for the first time. Raising humans from the grave is essentially creating humans for the second time. Of course, that is very easy for Allah. Even if Allah wants something to happen without going through such a process, it is not difficult for Allah. Because if He wants something to exist, it is enough for Him to say to it, "Be." Then that thing is realized.

As His word:

"Indeed, His command, when He intends a thing, is only that He says to it, "Be," and it is." (Yasin/36: 82)

5. Then the fetus is carried by its mother for the time determined by Allah. The normal gestation period is nine months plus ten days. The minimum gestation period is six months, as understood from the verse that the length of pregnancy and breastfeeding is thirty months, while the length of breastfeeding alone is two years or twenty-four months.

6. Then comes the time of birth. The baby grows from day to day into a child.

7. Children continue to grow into adults until they reach perfect condition, both physically and spiritually.

8. Among humans, some die before that ideal condition. But there are humans who only die after old age until they are senile so that they cannot remember anything anymore.

The process of human development from a weak condition to a strong one, from a strong condition to a weak one again, or from birth, to adulthood and to old age is described in Allah's word:

"Allah is the one who created you from weakness, then He made (you) after weakness strong, then He made (you) after strength weakness (again) and gray hair. He creates what He wills. And He is the All-Knowing, the All-Powerful." (ar-Rum/30: 54)

Furthermore, after humans die, life does not end. But they will be resurrected to have their deeds examined. Then they will be given rewards or prizes. Allah says:

"Then after that, indeed, you will surely die. Then, indeed, you will be resurrected (from your graves) on the Day of Resurrection." (al-Mu'minun/23: 15-16)

Then Allah presents guidance about the existence of the Day of Judgment and the Day of Resurrection, in addition to what has been presented above by giving the example of the life of plants that grow on the surface of the earth. Pay attention to the barren and dry earth, where no plants grow. Then rain falls and wets the surface of the earth. Then the surface of the earth begins to loosen and become fertile and then begins to be overgrown by plants. Over time, the plants grow larger, even their leaves have covered the surface of the earth which was originally barren, with a variety of colors, some green, some whitish, some red and so on. The combination of colors of the leaves is very beautiful and amazing and even more beautiful by the colors of the flowers which have various patterns of color. Then the surface of the earth which was originally barren has turned into a stretch of trees and plants of various colors.

After the time comes, the flowers turn into pistils which gradually grow larger as well, until they become fruit. When the fruit is ripe and ready to be picked, then people come to pick it. The fruits are a lawful sustenance for humans, both to be eaten and to be used for other beneficial purposes. After that, the dry season comes again, the earth returns to being dry and barren as before.

Such is the state of the earth, which changes its state every change of season, from dead and barren to alive and fertile when watered by rain, producing fruit that is beneficial to humans, then the plants die in the summer and dry up to be revived in the rainy season. Humans who think, will certainly think about the process of life and death of the earth and everything on its surface. His thoughts will certainly reach the Essence that determines life and death. Humans who believe and think, certainly for him all the processes of events increase his faith in the power and oneness of God, who gives life and death to His creatures, according to His will. If Allah has done so, then He is certainly able to create and resurrect humans again in the future, because repeating the creation of something again is easier than creating it for the first time.
text.6:
After Allah presented the process of human and plant development in the previous verses, the following verses summarize five points:

1. The Lord described in the verses above is the true Lord, the Almighty God, who determines all things. No one is capable of creating humans through such a process, that is, creating humans from soil, then becoming semen, *nutfah* (zygote), cells, *mudghah*, a fetus, then being born into the world, then becoming adults, having offspring, growing old, and finally dying and becoming dead creatures again. Who is capable of creating the process of human creation like that? Who is capable of changing dead and barren land into fertile land and being overgrown with diverse plants? Who makes such neat and meticulous provisions and rules, other than Allah, who is worthy of worship?

2. He is the One who gives life to the dead. Giving life to the dead means giving life to the dead, in addition to providing the completeness for the survival of that creature, both the survival of the creature itself and the survival of its kind. Then He causes it to die again. The Being who can give life to the dead, then cause it to die, is certainly able to bring it back to life on the Day of Resurrection. Bringing creatures back to life is easier than creating them the first time.

3. He is the All-Powerful over all things. He does what He wills; nothing can change or hinder His will.

4. The promised Day of Judgment is sure to come; there is no doubt whatsoever, so that those who disbelieve may know.

5. That after the Day of Judgment, humans will be brought back to life to have their deeds examined and receive the recompense for those deeds.

text.8:
This verse explains that among people, there are those who truly act and transgress beyond limits, those who dispute and deny Allah and His attributes, without any basis of knowledge, without strong arguments, and without the guidance of true revelation. Their attitude is solely due to their arrogance, turning away from people, that is, turning their backs on others. Their hearts are dead and closed. As Allah says:

"For indeed, it is not eyes that are blinded, but blinded are the hearts which are within the breasts." (al-Hajj/22: 46)

Such people, if given a warning, will not accept it; instead, they become even more disbelieving and arrogant.

Allah says:

"And when Our verses are recited to him, he turns away arrogantly as if he had not heard them, as if there was in his ears deafness. So give him tidings of a painful punishment." (Luqman/31: 7)

Those whose hearts are blind and who are arrogant are the ones who have denied Allah and the existence of the Hereafter. Their intention is to mislead from the right path, leading far away from Allah.

According to some commentators (mufasir), this verse was revealed as a confirmation and a stern warning from Allah to those who deny and dispute with Him, as mentioned in the previous verses. In verses 3 and 4 of this Surah, it is stated that the leaders of the Meccan polytheists, especially Nadhar bin Haris, disputed and denied Allah, without knowledge, and followed the temptations of Satan. This verse affirms that Nadhar bin Haris and his companions, and those who behave like them, truly dispute and deny Allah. Thus, this verse essentially provides a stern warning and threat to them, that their actions will have very bad consequences for themselves, namely humiliation in this world and the Hereafter.

From these verses and the previous verses, it can be understood that there are two main things that the Meccan polytheists denied. In the previous verses, it was mentioned that they denied and disputed the existence of the Day of Judgment and the Day of Resurrection, while in these verses, they dispute and deny the existence of Allah and all His attributes of majesty and greatness. Both of these are included in the pillars of faith, which are the fundamental principles that must be believed and affirmed. Therefore, their actions not only cause harm to themselves but also mislead other people from the path of Allah, because their actions will directly or indirectly influence other people.

They will receive humiliation in this world, such as the humiliation experienced by Abu Lahab and his wife, and in the Hereafter, they will be afflicted with a very hot fire that will burn their bodies.

text.10:
This verse explains that the punishment received by the disbelievers is proportionate to the evil deeds they committed in the world, in accordance with Allah's word:

"That He may recompense those who do evil with [the penalty of] what they have done and recompense those who do good with what is best." (an-Najm/53: 31)

Allah punishes disobedient people not because He intends to oppress His servants, but solely because of the sins of those servants themselves, punishing those who sin according to Allah's justice.
text.11:
This verse explains that there are also some people who declare their faith and worship Allah in a state of hesitation and doubt; they are in a state of worry and anxiety, wondering if the Islamic religion they have embraced can truly bring them happiness in this world and the hereafter. They are like people who join a war, while their hearts are hesitant to participate. If they see signs that their troops will gain victory and obtain abundant spoils of war, then they carry out their duties diligently, like those who truly believe. Conversely, if they see signs that their troops will suffer defeat and the enemy will win, they quickly avoid the situation, and if they have the opportunity, they even try to join the enemy's side.

Their condition is described by Allah in this verse. If they obtain happiness in life, abundant sustenance, power, or position, they are happy to embrace Islam, they worship with utmost devotion, perform good deeds, and so on. But if they experience misery, hardship in life, trials, or calamities, they declare that they experience all of this because they adhere to the Islamic religion. They embrace Islam not because of the conviction that Islam is the only true religion, the religion that is pleasing to Allah, but they embrace Islam with the intention of seeking worldly happiness, seeking abundant wealth, seeking rank and position, or to obtain great power. That is why they revert to disbelief if the goals they desire are not achieved. In other verses, Allah explains their behavior:

(They are) those who wait and watch about you; if you gain a victory from Allah, they say: "Were we not with you?" But if the disbelievers gain a success, they say (to them): "Did we not gain mastery over you and defend you from the believers?" Allah will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection. And never will Allah grant to the disbelievers a way (to triumph) over the believers. (an-Nisa'/4: 141)

The purpose of their actions is explained by Allah in the following verse:

Verily, the hypocrites seek to deceive Allah, but it is He Who deceives them. And when they stand up for prayer, they stand up with laziness, showing off to men, and they do not remember Allah but little. (an-Nisa'/4: 142)

Then Allah explains that such people are those who have wasted something very beneficial for themselves, both in this world and especially in the hereafter. As a result, in this world they experience disasters, misery, and suffering both outwardly and inwardly, and in the hereafter they will receive a very severe punishment by being thrown into the fire of Hell. Because of their impatience and lack of perseverance, they will suffer great losses and cause lasting regret.
text.12: In this verse, Allah explains the great loss they will experience, which is that they worship gods other than Allah, or they acknowledge the existence of unseen powers besides Allah and then worship them, or they believe that there are creatures that can be used as intermediaries to convey a request or prayer to Allah, even though those gods do not provide harm or benefit to them, neither in this world nor in the Hereafter. Such an act is a deviation that is very far from the truth. They are like a person who has strayed far in the middle of the desert, returning to the original path is very far and exhausting.
text.13: The disbelievers as mentioned in this verse are those who worship something that has more harm than benefit. They worship something other than Allah, whether it be humans, objects, or idols. Because of their disbelief, Allah inflicts punishment upon them in this world and the hereafter. In the hereafter, they will know that everything they glorified and worshipped during their life in the world, and everything they considered as helpers, as something that could grant all their requests, and as good friends, will have no meaning whatsoever. In fact, all of them will become companions who are equally afflicted by the wrath and punishment of Allah.
text.14:
Regarding those who worship Allah alone, not associating partners with Him in any way, following the teachings conveyed by His Prophet, performing righteous deeds, then Allah bestows His grace upon them, by providing a place full of enjoyment and happiness in the form of Paradise beneath which rivers flow, with lush and cooling trees, as a reward from Allah for all the acts of worship and righteous deeds they have done. This grace in the form of happiness in life they will enjoy forever.

Allah, the Almighty Lord, whose knowledge encompasses all things, who does things according to His own will, will grant glory to those who believe and obey Him and will grant humiliation and misery to those who deny and disobey Him. There is nothing that can change, add to, subtract from, or eliminate His decrees and power.
text.15:
The commentators differ in their interpretations of this verse. According to Abu Ja'far an-Nahhas, the best interpretation of this verse is, "Whoever believes that Allah will not help Muhammad in this world and the Hereafter, or wants to stop Allah's help that will be given to him, then let him ascend to the sky and try from there to stop that help. Let them see if that effort succeeds or not. And such an effort is impossible for him to do."

Az-Zamakhsyari interprets, "Allah will surely help His Messenger in this world and the Hereafter. If Muhammad's enemies think that Allah will not help him or intend not to help him, while they know Allah's guarantee of His help, they will surely be angry. They try in every way to eliminate their anger, namely by doing anything, even hanging themselves. After that, let him observe whether his action of hanging himself can stop Allah's help to Muhammad."

Some commentators interpret, "Whoever believes that Allah does not help Muhammad, then let him stretch a rope to the loft of his house, then hang himself with that rope. They will know that all their efforts and tricks are useless at all."

Although the commentators differ on the interpretation of the verse above, it is only superficial, while the meaning is the same, namely if the people who oppose the Prophet Muhammad are not happy with the progress of Islam and the Muslims, then they are welcome to go up to the sky and then see the situation from there regarding the progress of Islam and the Muslims.

As is known in history, with the rapid development of Islam in the city of Mecca, and the increasing number of followers, efforts arose among the polytheists of Mecca to hinder the development of Islam or eliminate the Islamic religion. All kinds of efforts to achieve that goal were carried out, such as cutting off relations, imposing boycotts, persecuting those who converted to Islam, especially slaves who converted to Islam, so that the Muslims felt persecuted and tortured. In the meantime, the polytheists themselves stated that Allah did not help Muhammad and the Muslims, because the religion he brought was not a religion that Allah approved of. In such a situation, this verse was revealed, giving encouragement and hope to the Muslims. So that a belief arose in them that the religion they had embraced was the true religion, therefore they were obliged to continue to spread it, and God would surely help them.

According to Muqatil, this verse was revealed in connection with Bani Asad and Bani Gathfan who had converted to Islam, they were worried that Allah would not help Muhammad, then their relationship with the Jewish leaders was cut off, which caused their lives to no longer be helped. With the revelation of this verse, all the worries that arose in their hearts disappeared.

From the verse above, it is understood that the enemies of Islam do not have the slightest ability to break the struggle of the Prophet Muhammad and the Muslims in their efforts to spread the Islamic religion because they always receive Allah's help in this world and the Hereafter. This help from Allah is affirmed in another verse:

"Indeed, We will support Our messengers and those who believe during this worldly life and on the Day when the witnesses will stand." (al-Mu'min/40: 51)
text.16:
This verse explains that Allah has revealed strong proofs and arguments to Muhammad to refute the disbelievers, namely the Qur'an. Its meaning and guidance are clear enough, easily understood by those who want to seek the truth. Therefore, people should follow and practice the teachings of Islam, which are the teachings of the Qur'an, so that Allah will grant them help and victory in this world and the hereafter.

The Qur'an is useful for people who have no envy in their hearts, whose souls and hearts are pure, who want to seek the truth, and who have a willingness to believe in the unseen (ghaib). People like those described, if they read the Qur'an, will surely believe, and the more they read and practice the teachings of the Qur'an, the more their faith will increase.

This is in line with Allah's saying:

And Allah increases those who are guided in guidance, and lasting good deeds are better with your Lord in reward and better in outcome. (Maryam/19: 76)

Conversely, for those who are envious, whose hearts are diseased, who do not want to seek the truth, and who do not have a willingness to believe in the unseen (ghaib), the verses of the Qur'an will not benefit them; rather, they will increase their denial and disbelief (kufr).
text.17:
In this verse, Allah explains that all believers, Jews, Sabi'in, Christians, Magians, and polytheists will be given a just judgment by Allah on the Day of Judgment.

The believers in this verse are those who believe in what Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) taught, namely belief in Allah, His angels, His books, the messengers He has sent, the Day of Judgment, and in the existence of good and bad destiny. The Jews referred to are the descendants of Prophet Jacob (peace be upon him) who multiplied in Egypt and were then brought back to Palestine by Prophet Moses (peace be upon him). They are followers of Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) and his teachings are contained in the Torah. The Sabi'in are those who acknowledge the oneness of Allah but are neither believers, nor Jews, nor Christians. The Christians are the followers of Prophet Jesus (peace be upon him) with their holy book, the Gospel. And those who commit shirk, which is worshipping other than Allah, whether in the form of objects, humans, or idols, as was worshipped by the polytheists of Mecca before Islam. Allah will give a just judgment to all the above groups on the Day of Judgment, determining who truly followed Allah and His Messengers during their life in the world, who fabricated things in Allah's religion, and who denied Allah's religion.

True justice has not yet been obtained by humans during their life in this fleeting world. How many people willingly change Allah's religion and then force others to follow that religion. How many religions deviate from Allah's teachings, but those religions can live and thrive with many followers, so that at first glance that religion is the one that is true and pleasing to Allah, while Allah's own religion is only adhered to by those who are oppressed by poverty and have no power whatsoever or are oppressed in their country, as if that religion is not the religion that is pleasing to Allah. All of them have not obtained true justice during their life in the world. Therefore, in the Hereafter, Allah will give true justice. Everyone will receive a reward according to their faith, deeds, and actions that they have done.

Establishing judgment with justice and implementing that justice is not impossible for Allah, because Allah is All-Powerful over all His creatures. He witnesses and knows all actions and everything that happens to creatures, both visible and invisible, both large and small, even He knows everything that is etched in the heart.
text.18:
Sujud in this verse means following the will and adhering to the laws that Allah has prescribed and established. It can also mean dedicating oneself, worshipping, and carrying out all that Allah has commanded and avoiding all that He has forbidden. Sujud, when related to God's creatures other than humans, jinn, and angels, means submitting to and following the will and laws or the nature that Allah has determined; they cannot escape these provisions, whether voluntarily or involuntarily. As for humans, jinn, and angels, sujud means obedience and compliance with Allah's laws, obedience in carrying out Allah's commands, and refraining from His prohibitions.

In this verse, Allah reaffirms His power over all creatures, namely everything in the heavens, on earth, the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, the plants, and all crawling creatures, all of which submit to and follow the rules and provisions He has given.

Allah created this universe and regulates it with His laws and provisions. Such as the existence of orbital paths for each planet in space. Each planet follows its designated orbital path. If it deviates from its orbital path, it will collide with other planets. Similarly, plants and animals grow and develop according to Allah's provisions.

In Tafsir al-Maraghi, it is mentioned that the sun, moon, stars, and so on are specifically mentioned in this verse to remind us that these creatures are among those worshipped by humans besides Allah, such as the people of Himyar who worshipped the sun, the Bani Kinanah who worshipped the moon, the star Syi'ra worshipped by the Bani Lahm, the star Surayya worshipped by the people of Thayyai, and the ancient Egyptians who worshipped statues of calves or Ibis birds. It is as if this verse affirms that none of these are worthy of worship because they are all creatures of God who follow Allah's will and laws. Only Allah is worthy of worship.

Allah explains that many people believe, are obedient, and are truly devoted to Allah because they feel His greatness and power over themselves. Therefore, they worship earnestly, carry out all of Allah's commands, and refrain from all of His prohibitions. They perform all actions that cause Allah to love them, so that Allah gives them rewards and honors them. There are also people who do not believe properly in Allah or do not want to feel His greatness and power; they perform actions that cause Allah to be angry with them, therefore they deserve Allah's wrath and humiliation.

Whoever receives humiliation and the wrath of Allah will enter hell; no one can defend and release them from Allah's punishment, because all power is in Allah's hands. Conversely, Allah honors those who believe correctly and do good deeds; Allah will admit them into paradise.
text.19:
This verse explains that the six groups of people mentioned above can be divided into only two groups: the disbelievers and the believers. Those included in the disbelieving group are the Jews, the Sabi'in, the Christians, the Magians, and those who associate partners with Allah. These five groups have different foundations of belief; one group does not acknowledge, and even denies, the fundamental beliefs of the other, leading to disputes that sometimes escalate into hostility. The second group is the believers, those who are obedient to Allah. Debates and hostilities often occur between the first group and the second group, as depicted in the *sabab nuzul* (circumstances of revelation) of the verse above.

In this verse and the following verse, the forms of punishment and torment that the disbelievers will receive, as well as the forms of blessings that the believers will receive, will be described.

The torment that the disbelievers will receive is explained by Allah as follows:

1.  The disbelievers will be thrown into a blazing fire, so that the fire encompasses their entire bodies, like clothing that wraps around and covers the entire body of the wearer.

In another verse, the condition of the disbelievers in hell is also explained; they are enveloped by the fire of hell until it covers their entire bodies. Allah says:

"For them there will be beds of fire, and over them coverings (of fire). And thus do We recompense the wrongdoers." (al-A'raf/7: 41)

Some scholars are of the opinion that the clothing that covers their entire bodies is made of extremely hot liquid asphalt, as Allah says:

"Their garments will be of liquid pitch, and fire will cover their faces." (Ibrahim/14: 50)

2.  Boiling water, which is extremely hot, will be poured over their heads. A hadith of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) also explains this:

From Abi Hurairah, he recited this verse and said, "I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say, 'Indeed, boiling hot water will be poured over their (the disbelievers') heads, then the hot water will penetrate their skulls down to their abdominal cavities, destroying what is inside the abdominal cavity, until the hot water reaches their heels and becomes liquid, then (the body of that person) will return to its original state.'" (Narrated by at-Tirmidhi)

3.  They will be whipped with whips made of iron, hitting their faces, heads, and entire bodies. From Abi Sa'id al-Khudriy, from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), who said, "If a whip of iron were placed on the earth, and then humans and jinn gathered, they would not be able to lift it from the earth." (Narrated by Ahmad)

4.  Every time they try to escape from hell, they are driven back and whipped with those whips, and it is said to them, "Taste this punishment, as a reward for your denial and disobedience."

This is a description of the *ukhrawi* (hereafter) torment that Allah explains to mankind. With this explanation, humans can imagine how terrible and painful the torment that the disbelievers receive on the Day of Judgment is, so that the description is a frightening message for them. This is one of the ways the Qur'an convinces humans and makes them aware of the denial and disobedience they have committed. What the true reality of the *ukhrawi* torment is, is part of the unseen knowledge; only Allah knows best, perhaps it is in accordance with what is described, which is physical torment, or perhaps it is both physical and spiritual torment.
